simK

License: Creative Commons Attribution CC-BY. Feel free to share and adapt, but don‚Äôt forget to credit the author. üòé

üéØ Functions to procedurally generate synthetic data in R for kidney transplant simulations. You can see simK in action, here.

simK allows to generate data with clinical and demographic information for a pool of simulated cadaveric donors and simulated wait listed candidates for kidney transplantation.

Synthetic data can be used for preliminary analysis and the development of analysis code.

Data generated with simK are particularly useful on KARS.

‚ö†Ô∏è This package is not a medical device and should not be used for making clinical decisions.

Instalation

Development version

The development version can be installed from GitHub, if you want all the latest features, together with all the latest bugs and errors. You have been warned ‚ùó

# install from GitHub
devtools::install_github("txopen/simK")

Main functions

This package has 3 main functions, with them we can generate simulated data for a pool of donors, a set of kidney transplant candidates and the respective HLA-antibodies for those patients HLA sensitized.

A detailed description of these functions usage, is available from here.

‚ö†Ô∏è For PT origin, all these functions rely on HLA typing at intermediate resolution as described at Lima et al, 2013.

‚ö†Ô∏è For NMDP populations, HLA typing were described by Gragert et al, 2013
